org.eng.util

Interface IProcessController

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractProcessController, RESTProcessController, ScheduledProcessController

    public interface IProcessController
    Provides the ability to control a process that can be started and stopped and restarted. Implementations call the listeners to start/stop the process according to the implementation. For example, an implementation might be itself listen on network messages which control the starting and stopping of the attached process. The process is "attached" via the listeners in the instance. The listeners are expected to perform the actual starting and stopping of the process. Implementations must be start()'d and stop()'d.
    Author:
    DavidWood

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  IProcessController.IProcessControllerListener
      Implemented to actually start or stop the process according to the wishes of the IProcessController implementation.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean addListener(IProcessController.IProcessControllerListener l) 
      boolean removeListener(IProcessController.IProcessControllerListener l) 
      boolean start()
      Start controlling and calling any registered listeners.
      void stop()
      Stop controlling and calling any registered listeners.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        boolean start()
       throws Exception
        Start controlling and calling any registered listeners. Must be called before listeners will be called. Calling this after already started must have no effect.
        Returns:
        true if started successfully or already started.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • stop

        void stop()
        Stop controlling and calling any registered listeners. Generally this cleans up any threads or other resources created during start(). Calling this after already stopped must have no effect.

      • addListener

        boolean addListener(IProcessController.IProcessControllerListener l)

      • removeListener

        boolean removeListener(IProcessController.IProcessControllerListener l)
